eu_initiatives:
The university of Nottingham is actively engaged in numerous projects funded under Horizon 2020. We are also involved in Erasmus+ projects and a variety of other projects such as under the Education, Justice and Environment directorates. 
 
The University is also a holder of the EU 'HR Excellence in Research Award', sharing as we do the EU’s goals in supporting the international career development of researchers. 
 
Also: 
 
European Research Area 
Innovation Union 
Education and Training 2020 strategy and HE modernisation agenda 
Research and Innovation initiatives including Horizon 2020 
Erasmus+ 
EU Health Programme 2014-2020 
European Structural & Investment Funds 
European Structural Fund for Innovation 
Key Enabling Technologies 
Open Science 
Research and innovation in energy 
 
 
 
 
Nottingham has branch campuses in Malaysia and China.

goals__remit:
Our Global Strategy 2020 sets out goals and actions that target areas of challenge while laying the foundations for on-going success into the future. Informed by analysis, reflection and broad engagement we have determined we need to consolidate and enhance our position as a world-leading University and: 
•Strengthen and enrich our core activities of Education and Research 
•Address the changing expectations of our students 
•Target investment in research strengths 
•Focus on enhancing quality 
•Continue to differentiate The University of Nottingham on the basis of an outstanding student experience and our distinct approach to internationalisation
relevant_communication:
Impact: The Nottingham Campaign is the University's biggest ever fundraising initiative, and aims to raise £200 million in philanthropic support by 2017. This will fund a range of transformational projects: from student-focused programmes like scholarships, Nottingham Potential and Cascade; to innovative research into major health issues like cancer and dementia. 
 
We also plan to engage 1,000 volunteers by creating a wide variety of opportunities for alumni, staff and friends to give their time and help us achieve our vision for the future.  
 
Corporate Marketing responsibilities include: 
 
    Managing the University's corporate identity within brand guidelines 
    Planning and delivery of integrated marketing communications activity, including printed and digital materials 
    Campaign planning 
    Research promotion 
    Development (fundraising) marketing
